704338f-a.title: Brooklyn: Flatbush Avenue - Myrtle Avenue
704338f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave. Lxtension, west side, between lyrtle Ave., (left), and
Johnson Street (right). Also shown are Nos. 134-144 Duffield Street, west
aide, between Hyrtle Ave. (left) and Johnson Street (right).  No. 134 is as
the right. The tall building at the right background, is the Wilcox Millin-
ery Building.
December 15, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPODUCTIONS.

704340f-a.title: Brooklyn: Flatbush Avenue - Myrtle Avenue
704340f-a.text:
Flatbush Avenue Extension, east sice, north from Myrtle
Avenue to Duffield Street. 1he buildings on the extreme
right are on the east side of Cold Street. View 2 shows some
slight changes that have teken place, especially the rebuilt
gasoline station and the removel of the ciner. Close observa-
tion will also show that occupancy of some of the buildings
have changed. Ihe low building cirectly across the roof of
the diner in view 1 and behind the Sobol Bros. sign in view
E is the Brooklyn Vocational School Annex.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: October 31, 1927
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: October 11, 1940
